p: Tissue diversity has been more thoroughly explored for eQTL data ( Gamazon et al., 2018 ; Taylor et al., 2019 ; Richardson et al., 2020 ). For example, an MR study found that FBN2 expression in heart tissue was linked to diastolic blood pressure, whereas FBN2 expression in lung tissue was linked to forced vital capacity ( Richardson et al., 2020 ). Such evidence suggests that biologically relevant tissues may be crucial for molecular-level MR projects. The sample sizes of tissue-diverse studies are small ( Gamazon et al., 2018 ; VÃµsa et al., 2018 ), so the importance of tissue specificity remains uncertain. Finally, QTL data are notably not functional and these SNPs may not accurately reflect protein activity.
